Detailed Description

Public library interface.

Function Documentation

int gpif_init ( gpif_session_t *  session  ) 

Create a gnuplot session.

A call to this function will fork/exec a gnuplot child process, set up pipes to it's STDIN/STDOUT accoringly and populate the supplied session with the necesary information.

Parameters:
session Session to be initialized
Returns:
EGPIFOK No errors occured

EGPIFINVAL An invalid argument has been passed

EGPIFERR Session could not be created

int gpif_close ( gpif_session_t *  session  ) 

Destroy a gnuplot session

This will automatically send a 'quit' command to gnuplot and do some cleanup.

Parameters:
session Session to be destroyed
Returns:
EGPIFOK No errors occured

EGPIFINVAL An invalid argument has been passed

EGPIFERR Session could not be destroyed

int gpif_write ( gpif_session_t *  session,
const char *  buf,
size_t *  count 
)

Write to gnuplot's STDIN

count will be modified by this function to reflect the number of bytes actually written.

Parameters:
session gnuplot session to be used
buf Write buffer
count Number of bytes to write / Number of bytes written (in / out)
Returns:
EGPIFOK No errors occured

EGPIFINVAL An invalid argument has been passed

EGPIFERR Unable to write

int gpif_read ( gpif_session_t *  session,
void *  buf,
size_t *  count 
)

Read from gnuplot's STDOUT

Try to read up to count bytes from gnuplot's STDOUT. Count will be manipulated by this function call to reflect the actual number of bytes read.

Parameters:
session gnuplot session to be used
buf Read buffer
count Number of bytes to read / Number of bytes read (in / out)
Returns:
EGPIFOK No errors occured

EGPIFINVAL An invalid argument has been passed

EGPIFERR Unable to read
